thread.title: Blind calls up defender, goalkeepers for decisive qualifier
thread.title_full: Blind calls up defender, goalkeepers for decisive qualifier - Times Union

author: timesunion.com
title: Blind calls up defender, goalkeepers for decisive qualifier
text:
Photo: Alexey Filippov, AP Image 1 of / 3   3 Netherlands’ goalkeeper Tim Krul tries to block as Netherlands’ Jeffrey Bruma, left, and Kazakhstan's Sergei Maliy fight for the ball during a Euro 2016 qualifying Group A soccer match between Kazakhstan and the Netherlands at the Astana Arena stadium in Astana, Kazakhstan, Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015.
Photo: Alexey Filippov, AP Netherlands’ goalkeeper Tim Krul tries to block as Netherlands’... Image 2 of 3 Netherlands’ team coach Danny Blind sits during a Euro 2016 qualifying Group A soccer match between Kazakhstan and the Netherlands at the Astana Arena stadium in Astana, Kazakhstan, Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015.
Photo: Alexey Filippov, AP Netherlands’ team coach Danny Blind sits during a Euro 2016... Image 3 of 3 Netherlands’ team, front from left, Kenny Tete, Jairo Riedewald, Wesley Sneijder, Memphis Depay, Georginio Wijnaldum; second row, standing from left, Tim Krul, Anwar El Ghazi, Jeffrey Bruma, Daley Blind, Virgil Van Dijk, Klaas-Jan Huntelaar pose before a Euro 2016 qualifying Group A soccer match between Kazakhstan and the Netherlands at the Astana Arena stadium in Astana, Kazakhstan, Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015.
Photo: Alexey Filippov, AP Netherlands’ team, front from left, Kenny Tete, Jairo Riedewald,... Blind calls up defender, goalkeepers for decisive qualifier 1  /  3 Back to Gallery AMSTERDAM (AP) — Netherlands coach Danny Blind has called up two goalkeepers and a defender for his team's must-win final qualifier for next year's European Championship.
The top two Dutch keepers, Jasper Cillessen and Tim Krul , suffered injuries Saturday in Kazakhstan. Cillessen hurt his back in the warmup and Krul suffered a season-ending knee injury late in the match. Krul's club, Newcastle, says he ruptured the cruciate ligament in his right knee.
Feyenoord goalkeeper Kenneth Vermeer and Southampton's Maarten Stekelenburg are joining the squad. Blind also added Paris Saint-German defender Gregory van der Wiel , who was suspended for the 2-1 victory in Astana.
If they are to win a playoff berth, the Dutch must beat the Czech Republic in Amsterdam on Tuesday and hope that Iceland beats third-placed Turkey.
